content: In what novel by F. Scott Fitzgerald does the protagonist throw lavish parties in hopes of attracting his former lover?

The novel you're referring to is "The Great Gatsby" by F. Scott Fitzgerald. In this iconic work, the protagonist, Jay Gatsby, throws extravagant parties at his mansion in the hope that his former lover, Daisy Buchanan, will attend one of them. Gatsby believes that by creating an opulent and glamorous lifestyle, he can win back Daisy's affection and recapture the past. The parties serve as a means to attract attention and increase his social standing, ultimately hoping that Daisy will be among the guests and see the extent of his wealth and success.
